description: West Ham United rookie Reece Oxford is set for a loan move to Charlton Athletic. The youngster wants regular first-team football and is poised for a move across London.
title: West Ham United's Reece Oxford set for loan move to Charlton Athletic
title_page: West Ham United's Reece Oxford set for loan move to Charlton Athletic | Daily Mail Online
text:
West Ham United rookie Reece Oxford is set for a loan move to Charlton Athletic.
The youngster wants regular first-team football and is poised for a move across London.
Oxford, 17, started the clubâ€™s first two Premier League games, but has made just three substitute appearances since.
West Ham United's 17-year-old rookie Reece Oxford (centre) is set for a loan move to Charlton Athletic
Oxford (second left) tries to win the ball during a training drill with his Irons team-mates earlier this month
The teenager, who can play in midfield and defence, is viewed as one of the brightest talents in English football.
Charlton travel to the New York Stadium to take on Neil Redfearn's Rotherham United in the Championship on Saturday.
Jose Riga's Addicks sit in 23rd position in the Championship table with 21 points from 28 games played - one more than bottom side Bolton Wanderers.
